title: Amazon Prime for November: More 'Jack Ryan,' 'Man in the High Castle'
text:
USA TODAY

Amazon is following Netflix's lead with last year's "Roma" (and this week's "The Irishman," among others) by releasing a film in theaters shortly before it becomes available on its streaming platform.

Scott Z. Burns' "The Report" stars Adam Driver, Annette Bening and Corey Stoll in a political story about a search for truth that got mostly raves at Sundance Film Festival.

But that's not that only Amazon Original that's available for Prime members to watch in November. There's also a second season of "Jack Ryan," a fourth (and final) season of "The Man in the High Castle," and indie fave "Brittany Runs a Marathon."

Scroll through for a complete list of shows and movies coming to Amazon Prime, from Bond films to "Creed 2." (And here are the titles that arrived last month.)

Nov. 1: James Bond on Amazon

A View To A Kill (1985)

Bad Santa (2003)

Big Top Pee-Wee (1988)

Chinatown (1974)

Diamonds Are Forever (1971)

Die Another Day (2002)

Double Jeopardy (1999)

Dr. No (1962)

Escape From Alcatraz (1979)

Everything You Always Wanted To Know About Sex * But Were Afraid To Ask (1972)

Fatal Attraction (1987)

Fire with Fire (2012)

Flashdance (1983)

For Your Eyes Only (1981)

Freelancers (2012)

From Russia With Love (1963)

Gloria (English Subtitled) (2014)

Goldeneye (1995)

Goldfinger (1964)

Kingpin (1996)

LicenceTo Kill (1989)

Light Sleeper (1992)

Live And Let Die (1973)

Moonraker (1979)

Never Say Never Again (1983)

Octopussy (1983)

On Her Majesty's Secret Service (1969)

Overlord (2018)

Reds (1981)

Save the Last Dance 2 (2006)

Soapdish (1991)

Summer's Moon (2009)

Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street (2007)

The Counterfeit Traitor (1962)

The Firm (1993)

The Living Daylights (1987)

The Man with the Golden Gun (1974)

The Ring (2002)

The Spy Who Loved Me (1977)

The World Is Not Enough (1999)

Thunderball (1965)

Tomorrow Never Dies (1997)

Training Day (2001)

Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family (2011)

Tyler Perry's Madea's Witness Protection (2012)

Jack Ryan (John Krasinski) goes to South America to investigate one thing, and winds up on a globe-trotting mission to uncover a far-reaching conspiracy.

L.O.L. Surprise: Winter Disco Movie (Amazon Original) Tahani and Mykal-Michelle from the YouTube series "L.O.L. Surprise" are snowed in with no wi-fi, so they start telling a story.

Nov. 6

Texas Chainsaw 3D (2013)

Nov. 8

One Child Nation (2019) (Amazon Original) A Sundance Grand Jury Prize-winning documentary about the consequences of China's one-child population-control policy.

Nov. 12

Angel Has Fallen (2019)

Nov. 13

Anna and the Apocalypse (2018)

Romans (2017)

Nov. 14

Instant Family (2018)

The Souvenir (2019)

Nov. 15

Creed 2 (2018)

The Man in the High Castle: Season 4 (Amazon Original) The show that imagines a Nazi America unveils its fourth and final season.

Nov. 19

Bottom of the 9th (2019)

Nov. 20

The Fanatic (2019)

Nov. 22

Brittany Runs a Marathon (2019) (Amazon Original) Jillian Bell plays a woman who uses running as a tool to help gain control of her unraveling world in this dramedy based on a true story, following its theatrical run.

Costume Quest: Christmas Special (Amazon Original) The kids thought they'd be enjoying a worry-free holiday, but it turns out they need to get in costume and face a new foe.

Nov. 29

The Report (2019) (Amazon Original) Adam Driver plays Daniel J. Jones, an idealistic staffer of Sen. Dianne Feinstein's (Annette Bening) who works to uncover the truth about the CIA after 9/11. (The movie has a theatrical release on Nov. 15.)

Nov. 30

Low Tide (2019)

The Feed: Season 1 (Amazon Original) Based on the book of the same name, the series follows a technology that enables people to share information, emotions and memories instantly. What could go wrong?
description: New titles on Amazon Prime in November include award-baity film "The Report" and new seasons of "Jack Ryan" and "The Man in the High Castle."
